translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The eighteenth chapter
Discussion of the one path

analyzed: ekena ariya maggena cattāri sāmañña phalāni sacchikaroti iti
translated: “Does one realize the four fruits of asceticism by means of the one noble path?”
“No.”🔽“Is there a meeting together of the four kinds of contact …
of the four kinds of perception?”
“Is it so that one who is not a trainee is not a person who has entered upon the way?” …

analyzed: ekena ariya maggena cattāri sāmañña phalāni sacchikaroti iti
translated: “Then does one realize the four fruits of asceticism by means of the one noble path?”
The Invitation Ceremony.
“By means of the path of stream-entry?”
“Is it so that one who is not a trainee is not a person who has entered upon the way?” …
“By means of the path of the once-returner …
by means of the path of the non-returner?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …
“By means of which path?”
“By means of the path of arahatship.”

analyzed: arahatta maggena sakkāya diṭṭhim vicikiccham sīlabbata parāmāsam jahati iti
translated: “Does one abandon personality view, doubt, and grasping at virtue and practices by means of the path of arahatship?”
“Is it so that one who is not a trainee is not a person who has entered upon the way?” …

analyzed: arahatta maggena sakkāya diṭṭhim vicikiccham sīlabbata parāmāsam jahati iti
translated: “Then does one abandon personality view, doubt, and grasping at virtue and practices by means of the path of arahatship?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Nanu tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānaṁ sotāpattiphalaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatāti?
analyzed: nanu tiṇṇam sayojanānam pahānam sotāpatti phalam vuttam bhagavatā iti
translated: “Hasn’t the abandoning of the three fetters been stated by the Blessed One as the fruit of stream-entry?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānaṁ sotāpattiphalaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci tiṇṇam sayojanānam pahānam sotāpatti phalam vuttam bhagavatā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Has it been said by the Blessed One that the fruit of stream-entry is the abandoning of the three fetters? “

analyzed: arahatta maggena sakkāya diṭṭhim vicikiccham sīlabbata parāmāsam jahati iti
translated: “Then it is not right to say that one abandons personality view, doubt, and grasping at habits and practices by the path to arahatship. “

original: Arahattamaggena oḷārikaṁ kāmarāgaṁ oḷārikaṁ byāpādaṁ jahatīti?
analyzed: arahatta maggena oḷārikam kāma rāgam oḷārikam byāpādam jahati iti
translated: “Does one abandon gross sensual desire and gross ill will by the path to arahatship? “
“That is not so. … “

original: arahattamaggena oḷārikaṁ kāmarāgaṁ oḷārikaṁ byāpādaṁ jahatīti?
analyzed: arahatta maggena oḷārikam kāma rāgam oḷārikam byāpādam jahati iti
translated: “Then does one abandon gross sensual desire and gross ill will by the path to arahatship? “
“Yes. “

original: Nanu kāmarāgabyāpādānaṁ tanubhāvaṁ sakadāgāmiphalaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatāti?
analyzed: nanu kāma rāga byāpādānam tanu bhāvam sakadāgāmi phalam vuttam bhagavatā iti
translated: “Has it been said by the Blessed One that the fruit of once-returning is the reduction of sensual desire, ill will, and confusion? “
“Yes. “

original: Hañci kāmarāgabyāpādānaṁ tanubhāvaṁ sakadāgāmiphalaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci kāma rāga byāpādānam tanu bhāvam sakadāgāmi phalam vuttam bhagavatā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Has it been said by the Blessed One that the fruit of once-returning is the reduction of sensual desire, ill will, and confusion? “

analyzed: arahatta maggena oḷārikam kāma rāgam oḷārikam byāpādam jahati iti
translated: “Then it is not right to say that one abandons gross sensual desire and gross ill will by the path to arahatship. “

original: Arahattamaggena aṇusahagataṁ kāmarāgaṁ aṇusahagataṁ byāpādaṁ jahatīti?
analyzed: arahatta maggena aṇu sahagatam kāma rāgam aṇu sahagatam byāpādam jahati iti
translated: “Does one abandon subtle sensual desire and subtle ill will by the path to arahatship? “
“That is not so. … “

original: arahattamaggena aṇusahagataṁ kāmarāgaṁ aṇusahagataṁ byāpādaṁ jahatīti?
analyzed: arahatta maggena aṇu sahagatam kāma rāgam aṇu sahagatam byāpādam jahati iti
translated: Does he abandon the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion with the path of arahantship?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu kāmarāgabyāpādānaṁ anavasesappahānaṁ anāgāmiphalaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatāti?
analyzed: nanu kāma rāga byāpādānam anavasesa pahānam anāgāmi phalam vuttam bhagavatā iti
translated: “But has not the Blessed One said that the fruit of non-return is the complete abandonment of lust, hatred, and delusion?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci kāmarāgabyāpādānaṁ anavasesappahānaṁ anāgāmiphalaṁ vuttaṁ bhagavatā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci kāma rāga byāpādānam anavasesa pahānam anāgāmi phalam vuttam bhagavatā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: arahatta maggena aṇu sahagatam kāma rāgam aṇu sahagatam byāpādam jahati iti
translated: “Then you are reduced to this: ‘Though the Blessed One has said that the fruit of non-return is the complete abandonment of lust, hatred, and delusion, still one abandons the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion with the path of arahantship.’
“You are reduced to this:

analyzed: ekena ariya maggena cattāri sāmañña phalāni sacchikaroti iti
translated: ‘One realises the four fruits of recluseship by one ariyan path.’
“Yes.”

analyzed: bhagavatā sa utāpatti maggaḥ bhāvitaḥ iti
translated: “Has the Blessed One developed the path to stream entry?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: bhagavā saḥ utāpannaḥ iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is the Blessed One a stream-enterer?”🔽“You are reduced to this:
‘The Blessed One has developed the path to once-return…
the path to non-return.’
“Yes.”

analyzed: bhagavān anāgāmī iti 🔽na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is the Blessed One a non-returner?”🔽“You are reduced to this:

original: Bhagavā ekena ariyamaggena cattāri sāmaññaphalāni sacchikaroti, sāvakā catūhi ariyamaggehi cattāri sāmaññaphalāni sacchikarontīti?
analyzed: bhagavā ekena ariya maggena cattāri sāmañña phalāni sacchikaroti sāvakā catūhi ariya maggehi cattāri sāmañña phalāni sacchikaronti iti
translated: “The Blessed One realizes the four fruits of asceticism by means of a single noble path, while disciples realize the four fruits of asceticism by means of four noble paths?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Sāvakā buddhassa bhagavato adiṭṭhaṁ dakkhanti anadhigataṁ adhigacchanti asacchikataṁ sacchikarontīti?
analyzed: sāvakāḥ buddhassa bhagavataḥ a diṭṭham dakkhanti anadhigatam adhigacchanti a sacchikatam sacchikaronti iti
translated: “Do disciples of the Blessed One see what has not been seen, attain what has not been attained, and realize what has not been realized?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
The Discussion of a Single Path is finished.
